Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: momof7pa
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here this week with a bus tour. I couldn't believe the place. Most of of thought it was oceanfront but it's not. I had a view of the street. The place is OLD !!!!!! No restaurant The one we were scheduled to eat at was terrible and a block and a half away. The pool isn't that great either , inside or outside. I would try one of the other hotels. The Dunes Manor is close by and is a few dollars more but looked great. Apparently White Star Tours books with the Flamingo only so I would think twice about going on one of their tours

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ken B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Flamingo from 9/6/12 - 9/1/12. We rented an efficiency. We were on the top floor of Tower 1 and had a perfect view of the ocean. The room was clean and comfortable. The maid service was excellent. I'm always skeptical about bad reviews. This place is not a five start hotel. It's a typical beach resort hotel. Nothing fancy, just enough for what you need. We will definitely go back to the Flamingo.

Reviews.Title: “quick trip before my granddaughter left for college”
Reviews.Author: Nannypetty
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter and I took an unexpected trip to OC before she left for college.. The staff was great. Everyone was pleasant and very helpful. Our room maid was great. Great hotel for the money. room was very clean and if we needed anything all we had to do was ask and we got it. The beach was just a few steps from the hotel. We would stay here again and are planning on going back next year. Thanks for making our quicky trip to the beach great...Roxie and Gabby

Reviews.Title: “Last minute, short family trip”
Reviews.Author: Christine W
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel at the last minute and wanted something near the beach with a pool. The Flamingo is very conveniently located near the beach, boardwalk, and other attractions. The room was clean but needed some updating, pull out couch was not very comfortable. Room had a small kitchenette which made small meals very easy and convenient, balconies were spacious, great view of the ocean and town from our side room. Plenty of storage for 4 people, nice size rooms, reasonably priced. Pool area was very nice, indoor and outdoor pool were great! Kids had a great time. Staff was very helpful, loved that we could use the pool and restroom facilities as soon as we arrived even though it was prior to check-in time and we could also use the facilities on the day we checked out too, which was extremely nice!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: j m
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at The Flamingo when visiting OCMD for the last several years. It is a very good hotel on the beach right in the middle of town. The rooms are a good size with balconies that have a good view of the ocean, the bay or both depending on the location of your room. It has an indoor and an outdoor pool and the hotel is within walking distance of several good restaurants, a large amusement park, and stores, if you need any of those "last minute items." I recommend this hotel because of its reasonable price, its quality ammenities, and its great location.

Reviews.Title: “short family trip”
Reviews.Author: familyof5mttop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Flamingo for a short family trip. We used to stay here yearly before we had kids. The reasonable price brought me back for this trip. Nice beach hotel for a great price. Clean rooms and friendly staff. Great location across the street from Jolly Roger Amusement Park, McDonalds, and Burger King. Two blocks from the beginning of the board walk. My husband and I used to walk it nightly, or you can hop on the tram. Only complaint was the indoor pool. The water had an oder (the kids still swam). Repeat customer and AAA discount!! I will definitely go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Notrealpicky123
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Ocean City and stayed at the Flamingo. I stayed here two years ago and thought it was a fine place for what you pay for. Well unfortunately, the only good thing about this hotel is the location for the beach. By the end of the week, there was absolutely no parking for those staying in the motel. You had to walk about a block just to get to your room. We had issues with the refrigerator and our balcony door. The door was fixed but the refrigerator was either freezing our drinks and food or not keeping them cool. Spoke with two different staff members, one was extremely nice while the other was extremely rude. Air filters were not cleaned because those in my party were extemely sick by the end of the week. For the money you pay, I would not stay here again. I will spend more money next time and stay at a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place with Fantastic Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa S
Reviews.Content: I've gone to this place a few times. Only reason havent been back since 2008 was I've been busy in my career. But I do plan to RETURN this summer if I can spare the time. It's WELL WORTH the money, and has all I need for a relaxing beach stay with a nice room with a view. I never found the rooms dirty. And I love the old decor--it's part of WHY I chose this place. Certainly better staff than the main name hotels. I've recommend this place to my friends AND my customers. Walls are THICK -- so I can SLEEP. A BIG Factor to me is the place is NOT NOISY -- probably due to the very good construction.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh.”
Reviews.Author: SuperBubble
Reviews.Content: Decor was old, but so is most of OC. Bathroom sink pipes were leaking on to floor. Bathroom wasn't cleaned well enough to remove the previous occupant's hair. Definitely a "M"otel, not a "H"otel. Bring your quarters for ice. No water pressure. Might as well take your shower over the sink.

Reviews.Title: “Flamingo Fabulicious”
Reviews.Author: Kingdoman7
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend at the Flamingo Motel. Irvine at the Front Office was fantastic. She welcomed us with open arms, a Flamingo Necklace for my lady and a 2012-13 Restaurant & Menu Guide. She upgraded us without charging extra. WOW! We had an Ocean View with kitchenette. It was wonderful. The room was extremely clean and was like that our entire stay. The indoor pool was heated and clean. We were impressed!. We will be back, for certain:) Gave it 10 out of 10!!!!!!..

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Lacy0702
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Flamingo just every year for the past 6 years on at least one of our many summer trips to OC. The staff is friendly, the indoor and outdoor pools are really nice, and the rooms are decent for the price. I have stayed in tower 1 and 2 and I have liked both rooms. For the price you can't beat it. The location is soooo close to the boardwalk too which I really enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Def worth the money”
Reviews.Author: sweber1120
Reviews.Content: Would stay again. Rooms were very clean and staff was great. No complaints. Been to OCMD and stayed lots of other places I could say alot about , but this was NICE.

Reviews.Title: “Fun but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Kmb21666
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family of 5 and thee beach was great but the rooms are not worth what they want u to pay. We had fun but probably will find something cheaper this year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: learn2laugh
Reviews.Content: My room was clean and comfortable, I had a clear view of the ocean from my balcony and the staff was very friendly and helpful! The pool looked inviting, but I didn't have time to use it. Its a great midtown location - only a few blocks from the North end of the Boardwalk and a very short walk to the beach. My priorities in choosing a place to stay are safe, clean, comfortable and affordable. The Flamingo met all of those requirements and I hope to stay there again on a future visit to Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “spotless, great staff and close to everything. Highly reccomend this place!”
Reviews.Author: HollyOwens
Reviews.Content: We watched them clean these rooms and were impressed. Comforters are washed, light fixtures, vents, everything washed with clorox anywhere. Housekeeping is very friendly and helpful. Blowers were used to keep sand off of walkways and pool area. We have no complaints. :)

Reviews.Title: “Don't Let The Good Reviews Fool You.”
Reviews.Author: blkbty
Reviews.Content: When booking a place to stay a friend once told me “beware of anything that has Motel or Inn in the title.” At that time I couldn’t really agree that her motto was true however after staying with this motel in late August with my kids, I totally see the reasoning in her motto. The room looked liked something out of a horror movie, The paint on the walls were pale pink, the carpet was just as dreary and the ceiling had water stains so bad that the kids screamed to be changed to another room. I called the front desk to explain the condition of the room and was told they could move me for one night but I would have to come back to the room the next day. I couldn’t really see the reasoning for that and as I was residing to put up with the hole in the wall I rented for a week, front desk sent maintenance up to survey the room. Once they got a look and smell I was moved to a new room but guess my shock when the new room mirrored the old room. I knew then that this was all the motel had to offer so why complain. I booked this trip as part of my son’s 12th birthday present and I was honestly expecting a nice little room that stood close to the beach at least that’s what the reviews described. I read reviews expecting to get the skinny on a place before I book and for the most part reviews are helpful but I’m finding it truer that places with Inn or Motel have very low quality despite some reviews exclaiming it’s nice for the price. According to the reviews for the Flamingo it’s a nice place for kids, it has an heated indoor pool, and the rooms are suitable for the price however, The design of the place is extremely flawed nothing is connected, the pool is indoor but not heated plus it’s a long walk across a public parking lot to get to it and of course the rooms are disgusting. The one true thing the reviews boast about is the closeness of the beach. If you get the right room you can see the beach and it’s literally a few feet away.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unhappy”
Reviews.Author: Carla K
Reviews.Content: Our stay was horrible! Considering we paid over $100 a night. The hotel was filthy and the rooms were so out dated!!! The shower head was falling off the wall, there was other people hair left over in the tub (YUCK), beds were very uncomfortable that you could almost see the springs, the pillows were probably as old as the hotel, we had bugs in our sink, the water did not drain in the sink either so when ya brushed ur teeth you had to leave the water off then the bugs would fly out, the balcony was covered in sand, the fridge was missing parts and all of our stuff kept falling out, the carpet was so dirty that my socks were black in the matter of minutes. Also, I had to wipe off the table with wipes since they were covered in dirt. The pool outside was filthy as well. The ground around the pool was covered in sand as well as the pool covered with sand on the bottom. The tables had food left over on them and the showers outside were just nasty. Not to mention the stair wells smelled like someone has been peeing in them. Don't get me started on the parking. We drove around for about an hour one night just trying to get a parking spot that my husband ended up parking in the loading section in from of the office because there was just NO where else to park. What is that all about? How can you not have parking left for the people who are renting from you. That makes not sense. We decided to leave our car for what ever we did next because it was not worth the bother of trying to get a spot to park at night. We stayed at the Flamingo years ago and I can tell you now that we will NEVER stay there again nor would we ever recommend this place to anyone. We paid over $600 for 3 nights and I feel that we should be reimbursed some of the money that we put out to stay there and they wont give us a dime back! Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Will come back with Mr. and grandkids next summer”
Reviews.Author: dana21108
Reviews.Content: Just came home from a trip to Ocean City, MD where I stayed at the Flamingo. The best recommendation I can give about this property is that the staff is excellent. They are attentive, patient and ever watchful, which was important as I was traveling solo. I felt totally safe and secure, whatever activity I was engaged in. I liked the Samsung flat screen TV, even tho I didn't use it much. Some hotels/motels have cruddy TVs...The Flamingo isn't one of them! I found the room to be very clean except the carpet and I'm just being a realist. I'm visiting at the end of the season, of course the carpets are going to be in bad shape. I'm betting most of the OC hotels are by and large the same way. Some have said that the bathroom was too small but I thought it was just fine. It took a couple of minutes to get hot water...but I got it. The fridge worked well, plenty of drawer space and hangers in the closet. Understand that there was only one of me...I didn't have to share. But this would not have been a problem if I was sharing. The balcony is essential for me, if for nothing else, to hang my beach towel. I had a room in the 1st tower, no ocean view...except when I was on my balcony I did have an ocean view! Yay! Great that there was both an indoor and an outdoor pool. I also appreciated being able to use a changing room after checking out (cause I wasn't finished using the beach yet!). BTW the walk to the beach is a snap. It had a restroom and shower area, only soap available. But I think they would have given a towel had I needed one and anything else as they are so nice. The best feature for me is that this hotel is near the beach & boardwalk but not on the boardwalk. I ate out twice during my stay and can recommend both restaurants. Mother's Cantina on 28th and Philadelphia had great nachos and nice, cold beer. But my favorite was the Satalite Cafe on 24th St and the boardwalk (look for the Howard Johnson's). My waitress was fantastic, the prices very low and they serve the best patty melt I've ever had, for $5.99! I will definately be back next summer and will stay in an effeciency with my husband and grandkids. Wish I was back there now!

Reviews.Title: “Great family motel”
Reviews.Author: sachet10k
Reviews.Content: What a great motel at a resonable price!! Nice inside and outside pool, within walking distance of restaurant and attractions. I have stayed at high priced condos and hotels, but will be returning to the Flamingo in future vacations. We had a kitchenette in Tower 2 with an ocean view. The room was clean,comfortable beds, our housekeeper Martha was just great, she was caring of all our needs. They also have a suite available with a separate sitting area and two TV's, whitch was also nice. Front desk was friendly and helpful, had fresh coffee made every morning. A few feet from the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: goldfishangel
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Ocean City, MD. A great family vacation by the beach and boardwalk. The motel was very good, affordable, and the staff are very friendly, polite and helpful. We will definitely stay at the Flamingo Motel again.

Reviews.Title: “Back for our 2nd year - looking forward to our 3rd!”
Reviews.Author: PIttsburghTraveler02
Reviews.Content: This was our second time stating at the Flamingo. We are both about 30 and I have been going to Ocean City every summer for basically my entire life. The Flamingo is not the nicest place out there, but for Ocean City standards is one of the better motels. While small and old it is cleaner than mostly anywhere that I have been in Ocean City. We have stayed in the motel building and tower 1. Like I said before it is old but very clean. It is also extremely friendly. The same crew was there working this year as last year. Flamingo is family owned and it shows. Both buildings basically have the same rooms (must have been renovated/built at about the same time). They just put flat screens in this year, and they have "ok" wifi free. The motel building is cheaper, but no elevator. A definate plus is that they do not tolerate loud parties on the weekend. They have a MD state trooper working security on the weekend and will kick people out if they dont quiet down. One suggestion is to bring some febreeze. The carpets do have a musty/mildew smell due to people coming in wet from the beach on the carpet. I think that this is the best value on the beach - they even give a discount for repeat guest! Thanks Flamingo for another great year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: gogeltj
Reviews.Content: The room rate was cheaper when we arrived than when we booked it. I think since we had been there before. We stayed an extra night. Staff attentive. Took care of things pronto!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, dirty, not worth the stay”
Reviews.Author: NeomiR
Reviews.Content: For the price of the motel it was totally not worth the stay. The room smelled musty. The carpets didn't look clean as if only a carpet freshener was used. There were dirt marks on the doors which was easily wiped off with Lysol wipes, which is why I couldn't understand why the maids couldn't do it in the first place. They didn't even leave us with a full toilet paper roll on the holder; it looked as if it was over half used (probably from the previous guest) we checked the beds and they looked ok, needless to say however we brought our own sheets and had to use them. The TV screen was spotted with dirt. The cleaning person knocked on our door 10 minutes before check out... there went her tip. It's a good thing we didn't stay there long. If I has to do it over again I would pay the extra 50$ at the better hotels. Lesson learned. Unless your desperate I would NOT reccomend this place.

Reviews.Title: “We return year after year”
Reviews.Author: sgardner42379
Reviews.Content: We have spent a M-F in July at the Flamingo for several years, and we keep going back because it is clean, well-kept, and a good family environment. We get an ocean view room in Tower 1, and have two double beds, small refrigerator, microwave, table and two chairs and outdoor balcony. It's gorgeous to sit out there and watch the sun rise over the ocean, and also to sit outside at night and have a couple cocktails in the sea breeze. The room this year was newly re-carpeted, and very clean, with clean bathroom with plenty of towels. The office staff was friendly and efficient. The room was cleaned thoroughly every day. The pool area is small, but the pool is clean. There is also an indoor pool at Tower 2 in case you want to swim indoors. We only used it once a few years ago. No restaurant here, but plenty to choose from. Only a block to the bus route on Coastal Highway, where you can get anywhere for $3 ticket per day. Beach is only 1/2 block away, and it's a nice beach area, not too crowded except for weekends. That's why we always go M-F - cheaper, less crowded. Very nice place, we will keep going back.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: beachlovers98Pa
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel!!!! Recommended this is an amazing hotel with the bes staff ever!! We stay here every year!!

Reviews.Title: “OK facilities, OK rate, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler52787
Reviews.Content: First let me state that MOST hotels in OC Maryland have a minimum 2 or 3 night stay. We asked several hotels if we could pay a little more and for them to wave the minimum. The Flamingo was to ONLY hotel that was willing to work with us even though while we were there most of the places we called did have vacancies when we were there. The Flamingo goes above and beyond in service; however, the facilities are older. Our room was clean (for the most part) and the pool was nice. It was an older motel (circa 1950’s I am guessing) and it does need to be updated; however, it was clear that the staff took pride in the hotel. The thing that amazed me was the staff, super friendly and helpful. And I mean the ENTIRE staff from the front desk, to housekeeping, and even maintenance. All of them greeted you and were personal able. The rates are pricey for what you get; however, ALL hotel/motels are overpriced in Ocean City. Good luck finding one that isn’t!

Reviews.Title: “WV Girls”
Reviews.Author: Tammy2222
Reviews.Content: We went for a long weekend. Had a great time! The Motel was clean and fully staffed. The staff was very pleasant and willing to help. The pool and accommodations were wonderful. I will definitely be staying here again and hopefully soon!!! Very Pleased :) The friends of WV

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again there”
Reviews.Author: Dwcerino
Reviews.Content: It was very clean and staff very nice. Party @ the salty dog bar, nice bar mostly sport bar on 28th street. Hotel 30th... 4streets downs make right to hit boards. Or walk on the sand behind hotel to them. Over all I am booking to stay again..

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: nycvegas
Reviews.Content: stayed here for one night. dreary, moldy, rust in sink. We stayed because we arrived and it was 10 PM and were tired. When I got back to NYC oh oh red welts on arm, bed bug bites. I've been receiving discounts and I wouldn,t stay there for free. Horrible go any where else unless you wanna be dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Old and outdated place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: brownsugarbabe_10
Reviews.Content: Very old and outdated.needs to be updated and cleaned up.Carpeting very dirty and bathroom full of rust. Had to pay to use ice machine.

Reviews.Title: “Wished I stayed elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: laney5454
Reviews.Content: Stayed in motel for two days - for the price I would have expected a nicer room. Smelled when we got there but left the sliding door open which helped. Nice that it had a screen to keep bugs out but screen not attached at bottom of door so not to useful. Behind another hotel so not beachfront but 30 second walk to dunes. Nice for beach, but 4 blocks from boardwalk but end with no activity. Long walk to get to the fun section of boardwalk. Quick acess to OC bus near motel so for $2 a person can ride bus up and down OC as needed. Lots of food places and stores nearby. Room ok in size, bathroom small and needs updating. Room needed new carpeting and bedding. Bed too as I barely slept the two nights I was there. Can not comment on the pools, didn't go in. Saw outdoor pool, not very welcoming - didn't even walk to the indoor pool. Motel has no elevator and of course on third floor but stairwells and walkways narrow - walking with luggage a bit challenging. When I return to OC, I will be finding a different location to stay.

Reviews.Title: “stayed here for 11yrs ....... dont know why”
Reviews.Author: ja3793
Reviews.Content: Ww started staying here 11 yrs ago the tower 2 i was clean and pretty new. every year it got a little more dirty and not a update to carpets or furniture. my wife always wanted to go back like it was a tradition so we did, the year the half eaten doughnut was under the bed from when we checked in i left it there for 3 days to see if it was spotted it was only about 6 inches under , didnt get cleaned until i called the front desk, the sliding doors never worked or locked, the bathrooms filled with mold everywhere . this year when we received a special discount card in the mail they didnt know when we called about it later after speaking to the management in honored it but raised the room rate to make up for it what a joke. never again After shopping hotels we found better more modern cleaner hotels for cheaper and you don't have to wear your sandals in the room or showers THANK YOU FLAMINGO for opening my wife's eyes

Reviews.Title: “It Was Okay For The Weekend”
Reviews.Author: lucysmama
Reviews.Content: The hotel could have been worse. You get what you pay for. There are much nicer places in OCMD and much worse. Overall there were no bugs (that we saw). The rooms were kind of clean..the bathroom could have been cleaned better..the window had a bunch of dirt on it..the floor was dirty..the beds were super uncomfortable. I normally travel with my own bath towel, blanket and pillow so it wasn't that big of a deal, but it sure wasn't home. The pool was fairly clean with the amount of kids in it. There was sand in it and it was freezing, but again it was decent. The parking is awful. We had to bring two cars and had to drive around forever trying to find a safe space for the second vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but older”
Reviews.Author: peachysmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed last week in Tower 1, my husband and I. It was our first time in the OC. The room was a good deal, I would stay there again if the beds were more comfortable and a little bit longer (we are aevrage height)..we weren't sure why our feet hung off the bed. Other than than that, yes the hotel is old, but the rooms were very clean, the staff was very nice, the pools were clean, and the hotel was quiet. We weren't awaken by loud neighbors or anything. It was close to Jolley Rogers for our son and the beach was nice. We enjoyed our forst time in the OC. If you don't want to spend $350 a night for a hotel room, this would be the place to stay if you want something clean and close to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: reggitt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value for a great location in Ocean City. Maybe the tower is more updated than the motel. We had an ocean view efficiency and watched the sunrise and dolphins from our balcony. Friendly staff, not party atmosphere like others have said. Peoples expectations are way too high. OC is expensive, and this place is a great value for OC.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK”
Reviews.Author: yatzee25
Reviews.Content: We were so disappointed by this facility to say the least. The rooms are old and dingy. the carpet was absolutely filthy-we walked on it for a couple of minutes barefoot and our feet were black. the beds were soooo lumpy and springy and uncomfortable. the ac unit was so loud too. and the room we stayed in was soo small and cramped we were tripping over each other just to get from one side to the other. on the other hand, it right by the beach. it's not a long walk at all to the beach or to the bus stop that takes you to the boardwalk. the pools were nice too-especially the indoor pool. however, we will not be staying here again though.

Reviews.Title: “great price. nice place”
Reviews.Author: neon13
Reviews.Content: me and my gf stayed there in may and we were kinda worried about the stay due to the reviews but it was nice. outdated but nice. but hey, your at the beach who needs a big nice tv to enjoy OC md. staff were nice. Vary close to the beach. vary short walking distince. If your looking for nice place to stay and on a bugget this is the place to be!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect value”
Reviews.Author: jessicayaq
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Flamingo the last week in May. I found a great deal for less than I thought possible. I expected the worst, but the room was very clean and nice. I loved having a microwave and mini fridge. The staff was SO nice and friendly. The hotel is nothing special, but is an incredible value. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Horriable”
Reviews.Author: wendy2957
Reviews.Content: Worst place we have ever stayed at. When you complain to the front desk they laugh at you. Beds were very uncomfortable. We were to stay 3 days but couldn't stand the beds nor room any longer. When asked why we were checking out early we told them the room and beds were terrible, they just laughed about it. Will never stay there again. The old saying you get what you payed for.

Reviews.Title: “second time at the flamingo, and greatly enjoyed my stazy”
Reviews.Author: bellamaxjoy
Reviews.Content: We were second time visitors, and got a 10% discount. The rooms are older, but the beds were good, the staff wonderful, and the view great. the boardwalk was just a short block away, and we had a wonder ful time.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Vacation Experience ever...DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: irishbleweyes
Reviews.Content: I traveled down to Ocean City for the first time with friends and stayed at the Flamingo Hotel. Not only were the rooms old and dirty, but there was no ocean view like promised and paid for. The hotel staff (outside the cleaning staff) were rude, obnoxious, and no where near the class of people I expect to ensure my stay while away on vacation. This hotel was sleezy, and definitely worth much less than anyone pays for it. I recommend looking around...and not getting stuck here...

Reviews.Title: “Worst place I have ever stayed !”
Reviews.Author: aluehrsen
Reviews.Content: The first day we were there, we came back to our room, and our door was wide open= who know for how long , we went to the office and complained but there was no concern thank goodness we didn't leave anything Valuable there ! We were told they only have double beds not only that, but the bed were very uncomfortable ! This motel really need to be updated !

Reviews.Title: “A good deal just past the boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: BrankmarBakardan
Reviews.Content: This is a very solid motel. Nothing stellar, but nothing to complain about either. Rooms weren't the newest, but perfectly good. We did get a free 'upgrade' from the side motel to building 1 with a side-ocean view. Whatever. The indoor pool wasn't as heated as you'd like. All that said, for being 2 blocks from the north end of the boardwalk and half the price or real hotels, we were very happy with the value.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Frequentflyer700
Reviews.Content: I recently went down to the Flamingo for a weekend getaway and the night hotel manager was rude and agressive to me and several members of our party. One female guest that was associated with one of the several rooms in our group is actually in the process of filing harrasement charges against the hotel and its management. The rooms were nothing special especially for the prices that were charged. Other nearby establishments verified the actions of the night manager as they indicate that he brags about his power to do whatever he wants on the night shift. Hotel management was contacted about the incident and has declined to take any actions. I would definately never stay here again, and I wouldn't recommend that anyone stay here especially if you have concerns about your safety.

Reviews.Title: “Average beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: redsoxfan9
Reviews.Content: Ok let me first say that I am not a person who goes out trying to spend over $200/night for a room at the beach. I basically look for a clean, bug free place to crash. During my stay, my friend and I stayed in Tower 1. The "oceanview" was a lot better than what I expected. The view included a front view and not some side crappy view like some places will try to charge you for down here. The upsides to this place were: 1) The room was CLEAN and bug free, 2) it was reasonably priced (well, for OC anyway), 3) the staff was courteous, and 4) it was on 31st st, which is close to the downtown spots as well as the mid town spots. The downsides to this place were: 1) the mattresses were terrible (very old) and 2) the water pressure, while the hotel was full, was crappy (this is prolly not a big deal though if you aren't a girl and don't have long hair). All in all, it wasn't a bad experience and I would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: nicol1103
Reviews.Content: There was a family wedding in ocean city maryland this year so not being from the area we had to get a hotel to stay in. We had a hard time finding a room because many hotels/ motels want a 3 night minimum and we could not stay for 3 nights. We waited awhile before booking but then came across the flamingo motel. It was moderately priced compared to the other motels. I never knew that ocean city was so expensive to stay in. We rented a room for two nights in the motel part. It was clean and like a basic motel room. There was a private balcony and the room was a decent size. The bathroom was a bit small and the shower knob was broken but it worked. Also the drain did not drain that well when you took a shower but it worked. Its a pretty basic motel room and nice if your not gonna stay most of the time in your room. I would suggest bringing extra pillows because the ones there were very flat and didn't support much. The only downfall was parking. There are two different lots to park in but the one night we could not find a place to park when we returned to the hotel. The security man gave us a place topark though. But i would recommend staying here if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mariaandken
Reviews.Content: my wife and I decided to take a vacation earlier this month and were looking for an affordable place to stay for a few nights....after checking numerous websites...we decided on the Flamingo Motel... We were not dissappointed...we found our room to be very clean...the front desk staff made us feel very welcome....the motel is in walking distance to the beach and many excellent places to eat....play...and enjoy the Ocean City night life... Having vacationed in Ocean City many times in the past we have had the chance to stay at several other hotels and motels in Ocean City but our stay at the Flamingo was one of if not the best experience so far.... We look forward to our next stay at the Flamingo Motel

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: cornfritter182
Reviews.Content: The price is good for what you get, but it's worth it to stay at a better motel. The rooms are old and cramped and the bathrooms aren't clean, and they let the "party" crowd in this hotel. I felt like I was in a college dorm. I complained to the front desk and they did nothing. The electricity also went out multiple times. The indoor pool is great, but they close it whenever it storms, due to the glass windows. Next time I'll spend a little more money to stay at a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Flamingo, Pink is the color of love!”
Reviews.Author: gableinator
Reviews.Content: The hotel so called the Flamingo in Ocean City, Maryland is honestly the only hotel I've stayed at when I visited the area. It is one of my most favorite hotels I stayed at since I was a wee little boy. The staff is pleasant and the atmosphere is great. It has a nice indoor pool to chillax at after visting the magical beach. Don't like indoor pools?! Well golly! It also has a outdoor pool. The rooms a very clean and well arranged. The only thing I dont like about this hotel is...there is another hotel in the way of the ocean view, which is the most important part!

Reviews.Title: “Okay place, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: Columbus_OHBuckeye1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Flamingo in June of 2008. I was traveling with my husband and 2 children, ages 3 & 5. I picked the hotel for the value and that was what I got. When we checked in, we decided our room was a bit cramped so we moved to a larger suite for more $. Probably worth it to spend the extra as the rooms are not big. The suite was fine and enabled us to put the kids to bed and watch TV in the other room without bothering them. A few complaints we had - the pools were cold, very cold! And, there are no amenities - we really found that being a couple with small kids, an onsite restaurant or bar would have made the trip tons better. We didn't really find any great spots near the hotel either and I think that staying along the boardwalk would have been better. We thought the motel was Ocean Front and it was along the Ocean but the walk to the beach was not that simple - it was a little bit of a haul with gear and kids and dropped off but once there, my kids had fun and we found some great shells. The boardwalk was nice - we walked it all the way and saw some places that might have provided a more "fun" stay for us. If you want a cheap motel just to sleep at and are free (w/out kids!) then this might do the trick, otherwise, I would say spend a little more and get some atmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “good basic motel, but needs some work”
Reviews.Author: mesgps
Reviews.Content: At check in there were two people in the office - a woman in training and a man who was training her. She was very nice and trying to get the hang of the process, but the guy kept looking over her shoulder and making her nervous, so check in was a prolonged affair. When we got to the room we found we had been "upgraded" from a room with a frig and microwave to one with a kitchenette, which was a nice surprise. There was a coffee maker in the room but no coffee packets. I went down to the front desk to ask if there was coffee available and was told - ungraciously- by the man that "there is no in room coffee." It's a little thing, but why have a coffee maker in the room without coffee being provided? The place was a little dated, but it was clean. We did see similar deals at other motels in the area, and next time will probably try one of those rather than returning to the Flamingo.

Reviews.Title: “Great As Always”
Reviews.Author: Antonia08
Reviews.Content: Stay here every year for Cruzin OC Car Show in May. Great Place to stay. Clean Rooms, Staff friendly, Great Location!

Reviews.Title: “3 Story Motel (Side View)”
Reviews.Author: letigre80
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights over the July 4th weekend. I paid about $345 and definately got my moneys worth. It was a last minute trip and I called the hotel to make the reservation. The receptionist was nice and easy to talk to, even at midnight two nights before the day I was planning to arrive. The room was small but there was more than enough space for my girlfriend and I since it was just the two of us. The beds and bathroom were clean. The TV was ancient but we were there for the beach, not the TV. We had a private balcony that was perfect for getting a feel for the weather and hanging damp towels and swimsuits out to dry. It's a bit of a hike to get to the main boardwalk where all the rides and stores are but there's a bus that'll take you there and back for $4.00/person. The bus ticket/transfer you get is good for 24hrs. I would highly recommend this place if your looking to spend little money, have a clean place to sleep at night, be able to walk to the beach, and not be too far from the boardwalk. It was awesome finding this place after days of searching for a mini-week reservation through a real estate agency and other similar websites. Luckily I stumbled upon TripAdvisor.com after checking out a different hotel with bad reviews. Overall, a VERY SATISFYING experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Connie045
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Flamingo Hotel for 3 nights. It was very comfortable, quiet, clean and conveniently located. We stayed in Tower II, which I understand is the newest of their buildings. While it does show signs of wear, our suite was very comfortable and clean. Havng a door to the bedroom was great so we could watch TV in the living room area and not disturb the kids sleeping. It was a very quiet stay - probably the quietest hotel stay I have had in many years. Even though we were on the very end closest to the street, we still had a nice side view of the ocean from the balcony. We had some street noise but the AC drowned it out. It is was so convenient having the indoor pool directly beneath us and our car was parked nearby. The indoor pool was clean but had a fair amount of sand at the bottom--which we probably contributed to. Just a short walk up the street to the beach. We also loved the location--not directly on the boardwalk but close to it, and also not too far down so we were close to many restaurants and amusements. Jolly Rogers is nearby and some great restaurants. My only complaints are that there was not an outdoor shower directly at Tower II and there was not a free ice machine on our floor, we had to go up to the 3rd floor for ice and you had to pay for it. My husband ended up walking to a nearby store to buy a bag of ice for our cooler It was a great value for the money. Sure there are newer and ritzier hotels, but you will pay dearly for it. Our favorite restaurants were Dough Roller for breakfast and also Captains Galley II (across the bridge bay side).

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, family oriented, good service - suite rooms better for bigger families”
Reviews.Author: shouldbecleaning
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our vacation at the Flamingo Motel. We stayed in a suite room (a living room and seperate bedroom-see virtual tour), which I highly recommend for a larger family (6 of us, 2 adults 4 kids). It is a little more expensive, but when I think of the alternative room - we would not have survived the 5 days I don't think. The only downside to the suite room was that it didn't have a full kitchen (stove and large fridge). The Flamingo is not the Ritz here - it is a basic place to lay your head and we had no issues whatsoever with service or anything there. The suite had a microwave, smaller fridge, toaster and coffee pot, but bring your own coffee and condiments (I put mine in a ziplock with the measuring cup). We had an ocean view, however the motel is not beach front, so no seeing the sunrise from here. Still....could walk the 100 feet to the beach and see it and also sit on the private balcony and listen & watch the waves crashing in. The motel was quiet through and through. The maid came and changed the trash everyday and left clean bath and kitchen towels for us and did any cleanup that was necessary (ie, rinsing the tub). The only thing I wish this motel had was a continental breakfast. It's hard to find one nearby though that has "everything" you want. I highly recommend it - did not feel it was dirty as some claim on here. No problems with water pressure as other people state and the pools were clean and useable. I've already reserved the same room for next year and will put the deposit on it in January. One other recommendation - Higgins, which sits catty-corner to the motel has GREAT food so be sure to check them out if you want an all you can eat seafood dinner. Runs about 30.00 pp for a meal but is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional Manager”
Reviews.Author: jae4
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a visit to Ocean City. While staying at the Flamingo, I was given the wrong room at check in. After staying one day in the room, I received a call from the Manager to advise us that we were in the wrong room. He made us feel as if this was our fault and not the hotel employee that gave us the wrong room. Since we had unpacked, and filled the refrigerator. I asked the Manager to give us a 1/2 hr to an hour to gather our stuff for the move. He told me that we needed to hurry up and get our stuff for the move to another room. After going to the office to complain about the inconvenience, another hotel staff member gave us an additional 10% room discount and some free coupons for breakfast and mini golf. Even though the room appeared to be clean, the sheets and blanket, on one of the beds, were stained with what appeared to be dried blood. In addition, the bathroom needed to be cleaned better (dried toothpaste on the wall and a dirty tile floor). Lastly the safety door latch was not completely screwed into the door and was cracked. I have stayed at the Flamingo, in the past, and never had these problems (about four years ago). I guess their focus on room maintenance and cleaniness has disminished over the years. Most other hotels will provide in room irons and ironing boards. At the Flamingo, you will need to borrow them from the front desk. In addition, they do not provide complimentary shampoo. With all this said, I probably will be looking for another hotel/motel for my next visit to OC.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Flamingo”
Reviews.Author: NYGirl13
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Flamingo three times and plan on going back this year. The staff is always helpful and friendly. We have never used the outdoor pool but always use the indoor pool. A couple of time we decided to extend our stay and we were accomodated with no problems. We always stay in Tower II and find it to be very quiet. This hotel also gives a discount to repeat guests which is a nice touch. The luggage carts by the elevator are quite helpful when transporting everything from the car to your room.

Reviews.Title: “NOT SO GOOD”
Reviews.Author: braves52
Reviews.Content: We were planning to stay 4 nys. Decided to stay an ex nt only because we didnt want to move our things for 1 nt. So I called from the beach and they said they would hold it. . Mind you now we were already staying there and we wernt going anywhere.. So when we came up from the beach to pay for the ex nt they hadnt blocked it out so someone else got it. They said I needed to pay at the time. I was never told that when I made the call.. The room wasnt the greatest but it was over the 4th and places were full. Wouldnt stay there again. Debbie for E. Fallowfield, Pa

Reviews.Title: “Great value motel”
Reviews.Author: sheriw1965
Reviews.Content: My girls (ages 12 and 10) and I stayed here last week during a spur-of-the-moment overnight beach trip. I researched affordable motels before we left, and settled on the Flamingo, based on several reviews here. We had a room in Tower 1; I paid for the ocean view, and had a very nice view. The room was small, but just fine for us. It had two double beds, so the girls had one and I had the other. The bathroom was also small, but more importantly, it was very clean. I noticed some people wrote the towels were too small - we had no problem with that. They were regular-size bath towels; same as you get anywhere else. I did have trouble with the temperature fluctuation in the shower, but I figured out that if you turn on cold first, then add just a tiny bit of the hot, it gets to a comfortable temperature with no problems. It was a little noisy at night, but it was beach week for seniors, so we expected some of that. Once I got to sleep, though, it was fine. One of the best amenities was that we were allowed to use the pool and shower room facilities after check-out. That added extra fun and time to our stay. The pool was clean and crystal clear. Chlorine levels were fine. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably can get a better value/experience elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: sjenne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a sideview room at Tower 1. It wasn't worth to pay ocean view rates when the view wasn't that much better at all. So if you have to see the beach/ocean, go for the sideview. Hotel is very close to beach. Outdoor pool was ok---at least they tried to keep it clean by vacuuming the sand out each day. No breakfast. Rooms were totally no frills. Very outdated--looks like they haven't been updated for like 30 years. Bathrooms had old fixtures that weren't clean (faucet had old toothbrush spray marks from the last person(s) on it). Shower temperatures fluctuated alot while showering. No shampoo, iron; tried to get a spare toothbrush at front desk but they didn't have any. Carpet was real old and if you touched it with bare feet, your feet turned instantly black, but unfortunately this is the case with alot of hotels. Microwave, mini-fridge and balcony were ok. TV was small and old, but worked ok. Hotel bills itself as a family hotel but it was High school senior week and there were plenty of them in the flamingo making noise. Traffic noise was very loud too. All in all I think you can do much better since OC seems to be taking its lumps by the high gas cost. Every hotel we saw on a busy weekend had vacancies. Be smart and look for the deals! They're out there and I even heard of one such deal when we got back home....

Reviews.Title: “Very Surprised”
Reviews.Author: amconcierge
Reviews.Content: I made a unexpected trip to OC this past weekend. After driving around to a few hotels on the Bayside (all had no vacancies) finally stopped at the Flamingo. Check in was quick and easy and the room was surprisingly clean and roomy. This was my first time in OC in the winter and the trip was short but sweet. Would recommend this hotel for a quick getaway.

Reviews.Title: “One of THE best hotels in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: holiday17
Reviews.Content: The Flamingo Motel is great, affordable, and convenient. At its 31st Street location, no other hotel beats it. My family has been staying here since 1999 and love it every year! Tower I and Tower II are the buildings my family stays in. Every year, we are treated with respect and our guest complaints are resolved in the matter of just a few minutes. Great family oriented hotel! The outdoor pool is great for the whole family. Oceanview Rooms are just as good as the Oceanfront Suites at the Hilton. Location, staff friendliness, and amenities are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “we go here every year”
Reviews.Author: emben14
Reviews.Content: Me and my family go to the Flamigo each year around mid august. The location is wonderful(steps away from the beach), the staff is very friendly( easy to talk to and get along with), as for cleanliness it could be a little better, especially with the pullout beds. We've booked the suite for about 3 years in a row now and the view is great, but some balconies arent private. the outside pool is preferred over thr indoor pool, which means the outdoor pool is filled to capacity mid-day till dinner. the indoor pool contains a lot more chlorine isn't as steep, and feels good to jump in after being in the ocean water. there is also paintings of flamigos throughout the motels and pools(which are fun to play with under water) and a few statues of flamigos. The motels smell clean and the hallways are clean, but the single elevator is always in use and has a build up of sand and water. Parking is crowded, especially after dinner time so you should go out early so you can come back early otherwise you have to park in a little lot with 4 or 5 parking spaces with no pavement(that means its sand) and have to cross the street. the road next to it isn't very busy, and motels are located next to Jolly Rodgers waterpark, and boardwalk is a few blocks away. ALSO the FAMOUS FRACTUERD prune donut shoppe , Which HAS the best donuts in the world and are made fresh with actual ingredients. the building is purple and green and was on roker on the road, so its been noticed by the food network, its only a block away and across the street so is candy kitchen. The flamingo is s good choice for a family getaway or with friends please check it out!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “sub-par”
Reviews.Author: chaoticbliss
Reviews.Content: Perhaps i've been spoiled by "typical" hotels/motels, but i was shocked to find that we had a mini-fridge and microwave in the room, but no basic toiletries such as soap, shampoo, or a hairdryer. We stayed in Tower I. The walls (and ceilings) are paper thin. The wallpaper was peeling. The "ocean view" was blocked by a 10 story hotel, however we could see the ocean if looking toward the left from the balcony. "Walking Distance" to the boardwalk is about 5 blocks, however the boardwalk vendors are 15 blocks further down. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: GDavis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Flamingo for four days in August with our 3-year-old son. While it is not a luxury hotel, it is priced very well for the peak season in OC, is very well located, and is generally a pretty decent place to stay. We had a room in Tower 2. I was hoping to get a full kitchenette, with a cooktop, but we ended up with just a fridge and microwave. For the most part, that was good enough to throw together some cheap lunches and keep our water/juice cold to take to the beach. The room itself was clean and quiet, had most everything we needed, and had a small balcony with an ocean view. I liked that we also had a small sofa and wireless internet. The indoor pool in Tower 2, was a nice place to dip into on our way back from the beach. Overall, we got everything we needed from the hotel-- we weren't pampered, but, seeing as this motel is cheaper than most other beach hotels, we weren't expecting anything luxurious. Ocean City tends to have quite a few fleabag hotel/motels, so going "on the cheap" can be fairly unpleasant if you pick the wrong place. It's nice to know that there is a reasonably priced decent place to stay near the beach in OC. The location of this motel is very good. It's a short bus ride to the boardwalk, and the amusement park across the street made my 3-year-old very happy. The beach itself is just a few minutes' walk away and there are some pretty decent restaurants within walking distance. It was great to be able to park the car when we arrived and not have to use it for our entire trip. I would stay at the Flamingo again. We live in Maryland and enjoy short, cheap trips to the beach. The Flamingo gives us everything we need.

Reviews.Title: “Old, worn out motel”
Reviews.Author: Framework
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where all the positive reviews come from because this is a typical older, smelly, worn out motel with noisy plumbing and rusty fixtures. Fridge and microwave were newish, but everything else in room was worn out/stained, etc. While $190/night is about half what Holiday Inn Suites charges, its still no bargain for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty Place to be!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lydia34
Reviews.Content: After staying at the beautiful White Rock Condo, we decided to stay another night, but in a hotel\motel. The Flamingo looked nice from the outside but the inside was a totally different story. The room smelled like wet mop. The pullout couch was absolutely disgusting!!! It should be replaced immediately, especially since children stay in these motels\hotels sometimes. I barely slept because I was scared that bed bugs or other nasty insects would be crawling on be throughout the night. Overall, I will NEVER stay in this motel again in my life. For the price that we paid, which was over $200 for one night, this place should have been exceptional. I would have been better off sleeping in my car. Don't stay here....go somewhere else....or better yet, sleep in your car for a night!!!

Reviews.Title: “really nice”
Reviews.Author: suzyshop
Reviews.Content: Stayed at motel for 5 nights.Good price,nice pools rooms were clean.it was close to a kids amusement park,grocery store and restaurant.Wish it was closer to boardwalk tho,we had a oceanview.All in all we had a good time.We'll probably go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “We Love the Flamingo!!”
Reviews.Author: Cortee123
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Flamingo for years and have always enjoyed our stay there. The staff is very courteous and friendly, and you can't beat the price. I have four boys, ages 3 to 13, who can get a little noisy at times, but we never heard any complaints while staying at this kid-friendly hotel. I have recommended the Flamingo to friends, who also enjoyed the accommodations and thanked me for the recommendation. My only complaint is that the bathroom is kind of on the small side and could use a little renovation, but it was kept very clean by the staff. The rooms are spacious and you're within walking distance of the boardwalk. I particularly thought that the housekeepers were very helpful, and the best part is that they remember us every year we came (they always remark on how big the boys are getting!)

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Year”
Reviews.Author: babs550
Reviews.Content: Once again we had another great stay. 6/30-07/07. We got there early like we do every year and we were able to check in before check in time. The maids who know us were friendly as always and had our rooms ready in no time. The weather was fabulous. This hotel goes above and beyond. If you need anything they are right there. We had a little action one of the nights we were there domestic violence and underage drinking. The security guard did a great job in handling the situations and had those rooms evicted in no time. The efficiencies that we always get were clean as usual and the staff is great. I don't think that there is anything that would improve this hotel. Maybe continental breakfast and that is it. This is an affordable clean motel. We will be back next year renting 4 rooms. Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in OC!!!”
Reviews.Author: StiletosAre4Travel
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the Flamingo Thursday, June 14 - Sunday, June 17. We stayed in Tower 2 and had a side view of the ocean. It was recommended by friends of ours. The room and bathroom was very clean! We found absolutely no surprises in the room. The maid came everyday and was very nice! The pools, both indoor and outdoor were always clean. With the exception of one night, we usually had the indoor pool to ourselves. We never had to worry about parking. It was ALWAYS more than enough spaces available. The boardwalk is only 3 blocks away. There is a go-cart track, water park, and amusement park literally across the street. No, loud teens or loud noise during our stay at the Flamingo and it was Senior Week(for high school graduates.). I highly recommend the Flamingo and would definitely stay again when we come back to OC! It is indeed the best value for your money in OC!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Shower lovers beware”
Reviews.Author: nva_wanderers
Reviews.Content: Because it was impossible to maintain consistent water temperature in the bathroom shower, my husband and I will never stay at this property again. Both of us experienced several shocking blasts of hot and cold water during each shower. Cold blasts are barely tolerable, scalding hot water is not. Our only decent shower was on Monday after most guests had already left. The entire bathroom could use a thorough cleaning. The textured bottom of the harvest gold bathtub has dark stains and the floor tile grout looks like it hasn't been thoroughly cleaned for decades. I hope the brown rubber tub mat is the original color and not stained from years of use. In the bedroom area, the drapery, carpet and bedspreads look fairly new and the furniture is in reasonably good condition. The walls, however, look shabby with peeling wallpaper and no pictures. The cheap mattresses, which look relatively new, were extremely uncomfortable and not at all good for a bad back. Lastly, it wasn't worth paying extra for an ocean-view room when our view of the ocean was across a parking lot and restricted to the space between two other buildings. We'll stick with AAA 3-Diamond rated properties in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Price.”
Reviews.Author: Hey_Vanity
Reviews.Content: My husband and daughter stayed here in August of 2006 for the first time. We paid alittle extra for the ocean view and it was well worth it even though the SeaCove building is right infront of you. The motel is set in pink as its namesake and there are little details of flamingos from the paintings on the walls of a very nice and very clean indoor pool area that I may add has separate mens and womens changing room areas which is a plus if you're not quite checked in and waiting around to get into your room. To the hotel stationary next to a fully operational phone,there are small touches of the pink bird everywhere. The clerks at the desk were short and curt during our stay, but then again, everyone has their 'off' sort of days and all you can do is shrug that sort of thing off. The cleaning staff were absolutely wonderful,they kept the rooms spotless and whenever you needed clean towels they were supplied. The room was a nice sized, the bathroom was leaky and needed updating and the towels were alittle too small. But we were supplied with clean fresh ones when we needed some. So be sure if you're the type whom like big cozy towels, bring your own from home. The refrigerator was well running,the TV worked fine and I really get a kick out of the 'Tourist Station" the AC had a cool and warm components if it gets alittle chilly in the room at night. I loved the private balconies where you could sit out at night with a nice tasty alcoholic beverage and listen to the waves and watch the sand cleaning machines sweep over the beach. Elevators were a nice addition,they come in handy from dragging heavy luggage up and down floors or you were simply too tired to hike steps from walking the boardwalk all day. The Luggage carts helped too. Outdoor pool was nice and clean lots of chairs and we noticed there was a pool guy constantly checking the ph levels which is a good sign. The beach is a meer few steps away and we could see how full the beach was during the day and the added bonus was watching the dolphins and porpoises frolicking in the waves. If you don't mind walking, the beginning of the boardwalk is only a few blocks up and you can grab a Boardwalk Tram for the rest of the trip up the boardwalk for a few bucks-I think 2.75 during the weekday and 3.00 for the weekend. Lots of places nearby to eat, but look out for Higgins Crabhouse across the street,they're expensive and don't really surpass in the cleanliness factor. The Pirates Den makes great breakfasts. I will more then likely visit the Flamingo again in my future travels of Ocean City MD. Also,I may add I thought it was very awesome that we got a Christmas greeting postcard from the Flamingo after we had stayed there this year for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for travelers on a budget”
Reviews.Author: creempuff0530
Reviews.Content: I have been going to OC for the past 12 years and have actually stayed here twice. For travelers who dont want to spend a fortune on a decent room, this is a great place to stay. Room was a little old, but was spacious and had nice beach view from balcony. Had both an indoor and outdoor pool which was also a plus. We traveled with another couple and requested rooms next to each other not on first floor and were accomodated with no problem. Location of hotel was also convenient to boradwalk without all of the noise you get when you stay on it. Overall, this hotel is a great value for the price minded traveler.

HotelInfo.Name: Flamingo Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 3100 Baltimore Ave., Ocean City, MD 21842
